subject: Re: [junit] am I  missing something?

 Hi,
 
 I m not sure, but when I tried the example, it didn t work because of the empty constructor of
messageBody:
On 10 Nov 2001, at 15:10, Franck QUINARD wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I'm not sure, but when I tried the example, it didn't work because of the empty constructor of TestCase which has package access.
>
> I had to declare the following constructor to get it working
>
>
> public MoneyTest(String str) {
> super(str);
> }
>
> Is that the correct way to use it?

Yes, according to JUnit's convention, you have to define a
constructor in your test case class which takes in a String.

>
> Thanks a lot for any help.
>
> Franck
>
